_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

The cause and reason why arguments, quar: A mendicant explains what is not the teaching as the teaching
A mendicant explains what is the teaching as not the teaching
A mendicant explains what is not the training as the training
A mendicant explains what is the training as not the training
A mendicant explains what was not spoken and stated by the Realized One as spoken and stated by the Realized One
A mendicant explains what was spoken and stated by the Realized One as not spoken and stated by the Realized One
A mendicant explains what was not practiced by the Realized One as practiced by the Realized One
A mendicant explains what was practiced by the Realized One as not practiced by the Realized One
A mendicant explains what was not prescribed by the Realized One as prescribed by the Realized One
A mendicant explains what was prescribed by the Realized One as not prescribed by the Realized One.
